JLK,

I have implemented a 1D spherical model in Cantera for my own research.  It
is not incorporated into the Cantera distribution however.  Also, it is only
in C++, not python or matlab.  It would take some cleaning up before I'd
feel comfortable distributing it.  Let me know if you are interested.

Karl

-----Original Message-----
From: cantera@yahoogroups.com [mailto:cantera@yahoogroups.com]On Behalf
Of jayrodnu
Sent: Tuesday, July 12, 2005 9:06 PM
To: cantera@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [cantera] Spherically Symmetric


I'm new to Cantera.  Just installed it today.  But based on the
documentation online it does not appear that Cantera is currently
capable of handling 1D spherically symmetric geometry.  If this is so,
I was wondering if someone could fill me in on the process that would
be required for me to add this feature.  What language is the part of
the source code that contains the equations written in?  Is there
something I can do through the Matlab toolbox to attain the
functionality I'm looking for?

Thanks!
JLK
